docs.lead_paragraph: It seemed like a coincidence at first. The patient, suffering from mysterious attacks of low blood sugar so severe that she sometimes passed out, also happened to have had weight-loss surgery a few years before. But her doctors doubted that the surgery had anything to do with her blood sugar problem. ''But then we had another case, and then another,'' said Dr. F. John Service, an endocrinologist at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minn. ''It just went on from there.''

headline.main: Blood Sugar Problems Found After Weight-Loss Operation

docs.snippet: A pancreas disorder may be a side effect of gastric bypass.

docs.lead_paragraph: The big man was slumped over his breakfast tray, face cradled in a bran muffin, silent and blue. He had crashed into the emergency room the evening before, bellowing that he felt sick. Escorted to a stretcher, he had quieted right down, and that was fine until someone noticed he was just a little too quiet, head lolling on a motionless chest.

headline.main: Patient Keeps Doctors Guessing as He Treats Himself

docs.snippet: Unlocking the mystery of a patient who uses a hospital ward to regress into old habits.
